meta.author: ToriBee
meta.source: I Come to You in Silk

data.value: A glass jar of your laughter, sealed and trembling. You can open it once to remember joy—but you'll never laugh again.
Silken gloves stitched from your childhood fears. Wearing them makes you brave but numb.
A mirror that shows only how he sees you: radiant, empty, devoted.
A crown of antennae, still twitching. You can hear the thoughts of moths… and they pity you.
A sealed letter in your own handwriting addressed “To My Future Wings.” You do not remember writing it.
A bundle of teeth that aren’t yours—but fit your mouth perfectly.
A veil woven from eyelash threads. When worn, you see things you shouldn’t: yourself at the altar, already changed.
A clay figurine of yourself, hollow and warm. Something moves inside it when you sleep.
A music box that plays the tune you were born to. You now hum it when afraid.
A moth’s cocoon stitched with a pulse. When held to your chest, it slows your heart.
A wedding band carved from a wishbone. If broken, you may regain a lost trait—but at a terrible price.
A gown of dusk, constantly unraveling into moths. When worn, your footsteps make no sound.
A scrap of your skin, pressed like a flower in a book of vows. You have no idea when it was taken.
A ring box with a live eye inside. It blinks when he’s watching. Which is always.
A comb made from ribs, engraved with your true name (you forgot it long ago). Using it grants clarity for a moment.
A candle that burns with your voice. It cannot be relit. Use it wisely.
A dead twin moth, identical to you in every way. Its wings fall off if you speak aloud.
A jar of air from the night he first saw you. Inhale it to remember… or to forget.
A letter opener shaped like a spine. Once used, you can’t stop reading letters not meant for you.
A kiss of binding, placed gently in your dreams. You wake with silk across your lips—and cannot lie anymore.
